result.execSummary:
The defendant Twan E M Parham was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Reckless Homicide [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.06(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Per Court's order on 6-15-15, restitution amended to $5,540.32, a joint and several obligation.

If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from prison funds at a rate to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision.  If extended supervision/probation is revoked or will discharge with financial obligations owing, a judgment shall be entered.
Per order of the Court on 3-11-16, $250 DNA surcharge removed as Defendant has already paid this fee.
Defendant shall submit to random drug screens including blood, breath or urine.

Defendant shall have no contact with the victim's family or their residences.  
Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Defendant shall not be in any place where drugs are illegally purchased, sold or consumed.  
Defendant shall have no contact with any known drug dealers or users.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.
Defendant shall notify any medical provider of his addiction history.
Defendant shall obtain/maintain full-time employment and residence.

Sentencing hearing on April 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Eduardo M. Borda.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth for State.  Resolution reached; PSI recommended with both sides free to argue; State moves to amend Ct. 1 to Second Degree Reckless Homicide as a party to the crime pursuant to sec. 940.06(1) and 939.05 and Court so orders.  State further moves to dismiss and read in Cts. 3 and 4.  No contest plea entered as to Ct. 1 as amended.  Court finds Defendant guilty on Ct. 1 as amended and orders Cts. 3 and 4 dismissed and read in.  Presentence Investigation Report ordered.  Report due to the Court two weeks prior to sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 1:30 p.m.  Court revokes bond.
Per joint request of counsel, 2-06-15 jury status hearing rescheduled to 2-10-15 at 8:30 a.m.
Due to a conflict on the Court's calendar, 2-12-15 Jury status hearing rescheduled to 2-11-15 at 10:00 a.m.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Eduardo M. Borda.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth for State.  State finds no Bruton issue as to this Defendant.  Argument by counsel.  Court grants motion to sever.  Motions in limine to be filed two weeks prior to trial.  Court will require counsel to disclose expert witnesses, CV's, as well as any summary of proposed testimony two weeks prior to trial.  Five day jury trial scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 8:30 a.m.  Jury status hearing scheduled for February 12, 2015 at 9:00 a.m.
Hearing on October 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Eduardo M. Borda.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth for State.  Case called at 10:40 a.m.  Court renders oral ruling on Miranda Goodchild motion.  Court finds that all statements made by the Defendant up until unambiguous assertion of right to counsel were in compliance with Miranda and Court denies motion to suppress with regard to these statements.  With respect to whether the Defendant's statements were voluntarily made, Court finds the statements were voluntarily made and further denies Defendant's motion to suppress statements made during the custodial interrogation only up until the point the Defendant clearly invoked his right to counsel.  Hearing on Bruton and severance scheduled for October 21, 2014 at 8:30 a.m.

Clerk: MS; Miranda Goodchild motions; State moves for sequestration of all witnesses w/ the exception of Officer Walsh, counsel objects; Court grants motion, any witnesses other than Detective Walsh must remain outside of the courtroom; Statements from State; DVD's provided to court were provided sealed as evidence, Court returns three DVD's which purportedly contained interviews with defendant Jives to the State, Court reviewed remaining two DVD's and directs clerk to mark them as exhibits; Court will not require DVD's to be played in court;  WITNESS: Peter D Rank (WCSD),  Parties stipulate to identification of the Def; State stipulates that Def was in custody at the time of questioning; Def will not be presenting any evidence or testimony; Def requests opportunity to submit brief in writing; Court grants request; Evidence re: motion closed; Def's written submission due  8/29/14, States reply due 9/12/14;  Oral decision scheduled for October 3, 2014 at 10:30 am.

As to Defendants Parham and Schroeder, Court directs Miranda Goodchild motions and any supplemental severance motions to be filed no later than 7-11-2014.  Motion to sever Defendants as to Defendant Parham and Defendant Schroeder are held in abeyance. Miranda Goodchild hearing scheduled for July 25, 2014 at 1:30 p.m.  Court will excuse Atty.
